title: Calories in 1 Tbsp Olive Oil
meta_description: Learn calories in 1 tbsp olive oil (about 120 kcal from healthy fats), plus carbs, protein, fat details, basis values, and usage tweaks for better cooking.
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil; 1 tbsp ≈ 15 ml or 13.5 g; measured at room temperature, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (extra virgin, refined), brand, and exact volume; always check labels for precision.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of olive oil provides 120 calories, all from fat with no carbs or protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use refined (light) olive oil instead of extra virgin
Infuse with 1 tsp fresh herbs (e.g., basil)
Mix 1 tbsp oil with 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar for dressing

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tbsp olive oil?
Is olive oil high in healthy fats?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp has 14 g fat, mostly monounsaturated (about 10 g) for heart health.

faqs.q: Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No—0 g carbs, fiber, sugars, or protein per tablespoon.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories between extra virgin and regular olive oil?
faqs.a: Negligible; both around 120 kcal per tbsp, though extra virgin retains more antioxidants.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in olive oil?
faqs.a: Calories remain the same, but high heat may alter nutritional benefits; use for low-medium cooking.
